meanings.definition: The action of deposing someone, especially a monarch.
meanings.sent1: The deposition of the king led to a new ruler taking the throne.
meanings.sent2: During the deposition, the queen was removed from power.
meanings.sent3: The deposition of the ruler was unexpected and caused a stir in the kingdom.
meanings.sent4: The deposition of the monarch was like a sudden storm in the calm royal court.
meanings.sent5: The deposition of the king was a dramatic event that changed the kingdom forever.

meanings.definition: The process of giving sworn evidence.
meanings.sent1: In court, the witness had to provide a deposition of what they saw.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer reviewed the deposition before the trial.
meanings.sent3: The deposition in the courtroom made everyone pay attention.
meanings.sent4: Her deposition was as solid as a rock, convincing the jury of the truth.
meanings.sent5: The deposition was a key piece of evidence that helped solve the case.

meanings.sent1: The deposition of money into the bank account was quick and easy.
meanings.sent2: She made a deposition of the documents in the designated box.
meanings.sent3: The deposition of the package on the doorstep surprised the recipient.
meanings.sent4: The deposition of the seeds in the soil marked the beginning of a new garden.
meanings.sent5: His deposition of the keys on the table signaled the end of the day.
